abstract: Google said the collection of data was inadvertent, and Britain’s information commissioner said the company would escape fines so long as it pledged not to do it again.
snippet: Google said the collection of data was inadvertent, and Britain’s information commissioner said the company would escape fines so long as it pledged not to do it again.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  British data protection officials said Wednesday that Google had committed a “significant breach” of privacy laws when its Street View mapping service gathered e-mail messages, computer passwords and other personal information without the owners’ knowledge.

headline.main: British Agency Says Google Violated Privacy Law
headline.print_headline: British Agency Says Google Violated Privacy Law
